recipesJson.name: Springtime
recipesJson.author: Kopel
recipesJson.description:
A sweet springtime floral blend to match the incoming warm weather. I started building on this after I tried Cheeba Steeba's excellent recipe Summertime.


FLV Pink Guava: The main body of this flavor is FLV Pink Guava. At 1% it comes through more grapefruit than guava.

FLV Lychee: My earlier versions used this higher but I found it was adding a bit of an astringent back note. Dialed back to .75% it gives the FLV Pink Guava a nice sweet back note, while still letting the Lychee stand out just a little.

TPA Honeysuckle: 4% here gives a nice, juicy backdrop to support the FLV Guava and FLV Lychee. Earlier versions left this lacking a little at 3-3.5%

FLV Sweet Coconut: At .25% this gives us a slight candy finish that helps to sweeten and soften the somewhat sharp Lychee and Guava notes.

FLV Elderflower: A touch of floral elderflower to finish the recipe off. At .25% it doesn't stand out very much, it's just enough to give some depth the the TPA Honeysuckle.

reviews.text: Springtime is such a perfect name for this recipe, the overall flavor is just an explosion of fresh floral vibes, and the citrusy grapefruit note from pink guava gives it the perfect balance. The elderflower is very subtle, but it pairs beautifully with the sweetness of the lychee and honeysuckle. The lychee is at a perfect level here, it can easily become funky when you use it too high, but the funk here is working to its advantage. This is going in to my ADV rotation. Thanks for the great recipe!

It's a great recipe, well ballanced. Didn't think the pink guava and lychee were going to work with honeysuckle at these percentages. I'm pleased with the result. The honeysuckle is still in there. I'm digging the floral notes from the elderflower as well. It's subtle but it's there. For me the pink guava is still pink guava and no grapefruit. But hey, I love it. Great job.

Watched a rerun of the noted floral episode and decided i would try some recipes. This is excellent with only a day steep the floral notes are coming through and that pink guava (grapefruit) is an amazing addition

Pink Guava is very upfront for the first few days. Then it mellows just a enough to let the honeysuckle and the elderflower break through. While you still get the upfront pink guava (which is great ), it's followed by the florals. The Sweet Coconut is a very nice addition, that I'm picking up on the exhale. Making this a pretty complex recipe for only 5 flavors. Awesome job! And a perfect vape for the "Springtime"!
